sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均有"思想，观点，观念"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: idea, concept, conception, thought, notion, impression
means: idea ： 最普通常用词，几乎适用于任何方面的思维活动。
concept ： 指从众多实例中通过概括、归纳而形成的对事物本质、全貌及其内部联系的概念或看法。
conception ： 通常指个人或一些人所持有的具体概念或念头，也可指概念的形成过程，含一定的想象和感情色彩意味。
thought ： 指以推理、思考等智力活动为基础的心理思维活动及其结果。
notion ： 指的是一种模糊的，变化的莫测的想法，无可靠的基础，未经深思熟虑的观点。
impression ： 指外部刺激在思想中所产生的印象。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"意见，看法，见解"之意。
means: opinion ： 普通用词，使用广泛。多指初步的或缺证据支持因而不十分肯定的意见或看法。
view ： 侧重指个人对较广泛或重大问题所持的看法，常用复数形式。
sentiment ： 着重指基于情感而非推理所得出的，已经固定了的看法，常用复数形式。
idea ： 普通用词，通常指凭感觉和想象所形成的看法或意见。

list.explanation: 不受欢迎的建议或行动，馊主意

word_mean: 意，意念。获得印象，形成记忆。

entry.def: An idea is a plan, suggestion, or possible course of action.

example.ex: It's a good idea to plan ahead...
example.tran: 提前做计划是个好主意。

example.ex: I really like the idea of helping people...
example.tran: 我非常赞同帮助他人的提议。

entry.def: An idea is an opinion or belief about what something is like or should be like.

example.ex: Some of his ideas about democracy are entirely his own.
example.tran: 他关于民主的一些观点完全是他自己的创见。

example.ex: ...the idea that reading too many books ruins your eyes...
example.tran: 读书过多损害眼睛的看法

entry.def: If someone gives you an idea of something, they give you information about it without being very exact or giving a lot of detail.

example.ex: This table will give you some idea of how levels of ability can be measured...
example.tran: 这张表格会让你大致了解能力水平可以怎样评估。

example.ex: Could you give us an idea of the range of complaints you've been receiving?...
example.tran: 你能跟我们大致讲一下今年收到的投诉的范围吗？

entry.def: If you have an idea of something, you know about it to some extent.

example.ex: By the end of the week you will have a clear idea of what your eating habits are...
example.tran: 到这周末你便会清楚自己的饮食习惯了。

example.ex: No one has any real idea how much the company will make next year.
example.tran: 没人真的知道该公司明年会赚多少钱。

entry.def: If you have an idea that something is the case, you think that it may be the case, although you are not certain.

example.ex: I had an idea that he joined the army later, but I may be wrong.
example.tran: 我猜他后来参军了，但也可能我猜得不对。

entry.def: The idea of an action or activity is its aim or purpose.

example.ex: The idea is to encourage people to get to know their neighbours.
example.tran: 其目的是促使人们结识邻居。

entry.def: If you have the idea of doing something, you intend to do it.

example.ex: He sent for a number of books he admired with the idea of re-reading them...
example.tran: 他订购了一些自己喜欢的书，打算重新再读一遍。

example.ex: I had to postpone ideas of a career and stay at home.
example.tran: 我不得不暂缓就业打算，呆在家里。

entry.def: You can use idea in expressions such as I've no idea or I haven't the faintest idea to emphasize that you do not know something.
entry.tran: (表示强调)我不知道/我一点儿都不知道

example.ex: 'Is she coming by coach?' — 'Well I've no idea.'
example.tran: “她坐长途汽车来吗?”——“哦，我不知道。”

example.ex: We haven't the faintest idea where he is.
example.tran: 我们根本不知道他在哪里。

entry.def: If someone gets the idea, they understand how to do something or they understand what you are telling them.

example.ex: It isn't  too difficult once you get the idea...
example.tran: 你一旦弄懂了，就不太难了。

example.ex: You're beginning to get the idea.

entry.def: You can say you have no idea to emphasize how good or bad something is.
entry.tran: (强调好或糟糕的程度)你都意想不到，你想象不出

example.ex: We are both so happy, you have no idea...
example.tran: 你肯定想象不出来，我们俩都这么幸福。

example.ex: You have no idea how depressed it made me.
example.tran: 你都想象不出这事令我多么沮丧。

means.word_mean: 1. the content of cognition; the main thing you are thinking about;

sentences.sentence: "he has an idea that we don't like him"

means.word_mean: 3. an approximate calculation of quantity or degree or worth;

sentences.sentence: "an estimate of what it would cost"
"a rough idea how long it would take"

means.word_mean: 4. your intention; what you intend to do;

sentences.sentence: "he had in mind to see his old teacher"
"the idea of the game is to capture all the pieces"

means.word_mean: 5. (music) melodic subject of a musical composition;

sentences.sentence: "the theme is announced in the first measures"
"the accompanist picked up the idea and elaborated it"
